column5: OMG Connie, that does not look like fun, well unless you have a snowmobile
Ouch ! That is what you call a "cold front" Hope you are making the best of it

No words required, pictures say it all. Looks like a great day to stay inside, unless you want to shovel out the boat.  Or as Joey said, get the sled all gassed up and go for a ride.  Not what you were hoping for weather wise I'm sure. I'll pass on that weather for a couple of months at least.
Kinda looks like Tennesee No worries, that stuff will be coming our way before we know it.
Doesn't seem to be affecting you much, Connie. Deadstickin' through the ice should get you a few good sized esox. Thanks for the update. I hope the weather clears out for you.
Hunters will be happy.. they can follow the tracks! Brett on the other hand... unless you're brooming the snow of that Dehaviland!!
Looks like your "stuck" there for a bit longer... gosh darn it huh.

I'm assuming this is the Little Verimillion lake in northen Ontario?  That should get a few more ducks on the move, heading my way!  Thanks for posting the pictures.  I alway enjoy this time of year.  A few more weeks and Drifter will be doing some ice riding!

I'm in Tennessee, after arriving home at 1:00 a.m. yesterday morning.  Late Saturday afternoon I hitched a flight out of camp, but not to where my van was waiting for me.  A truck ride got me to my van.  Wayne, I was amazed and impressed with the cooperation among pilots and plane owners in coordinating their efforts to pick up hunters from outpost camps.  No float plane went anywhere without a load.  Fuel stashes were shared when extra runs needed to be made.  I would have stayed another week with a hint of decent fishing conditions.
I could see my breath just looking at those pics!
At least you were stuck at Sportsmans instead of the Balmertown Motel  Just glad I got to see the pictures this time
At least you missed the mosquitoes and black flies?
Wow, I'm not even close to being ready for anything like that.
I got cold just looking at those photos Connie! Glad you made it back safe!
